conclusion: Analyze paths from points A, B, C, and D to containers E and F.
Liquid flows downward from point A.
Liquid encounters a red baffle directing it to the right from point A.
Liquid from point A flows down and reaches container E.
Liquid flows downward from point B.
Liquid encounters a purple baffle directing it to the right from point B.
Liquid from point B flows down and reaches container E.
Liquid flows downward from point C.
Liquid encounters a black baffle directing it to the left from point C.
Liquid from point C flows down and reaches container F.
Liquid flows downward from point D.
Liquid encounters a cyan baffle directing it to the left from point D.
Liquid from point D flows down and reaches container F.
Liquids from points A and B will flow into container E.
Liquids from points C and D will flow into container F.
Container E will receive liquid from points A and B; container F will receive liquid from points C and D.
